title: Learning Motivation Enhancement Program Through Scientific Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Online real-time science education course conducted in a smartphone-based limited-technology environment. Includes research objectives to validate inquiry-based learning methods, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Students enhance self-efficacy (success expectancy) in scientific problem-solving processes by over 20% through confirmatory and structured inquiry activities
Students demonstrate a 15% or greater increase in intrinsic motivation toward science learning after inquiry-based learning compared to pre-assessment

Students will design one scientific question during a two-week inquiry period, submit a five-page project report documenting experimental procedures (including variable control and data collection methods), and achieve scores of 4/5 or higher in at least four of five rubric criteria (clarity, systematicity, creativity, scientific rigor, completeness).

resources: Mobile-Compatible Online Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Docs)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
